New Records: Chicago White Sox set a modern major league record with their 121st loss.
Key Match Events: Detroit Tigers clinched a spot in the playoffs with a 4-1 win over the Chicago White Sox.
Riley Greene put Detroit ahead 3-1 with a double in the seventh inning.
Jake Rogers scored when Jared Shuster was charged with a wild pitch.
Fraser Ellard threw the team's third wild pitch of the night.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit went into the season expecting to contend for a spot in the playoffs in a second full season under president of basketball operations Scott Harris and A.J. Hinch's fourth year as manager.
Post-Match Reflections: The Motor City's baseball team salvaged the season and revived interest, drawing big crowds after closing recent seasons in a mostly empty ballpark.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit Tigers have been the hottest team in the majors since August 11 with 31 wins in 42 games, the lowest ERA in baseball, and the largest run differential.
AL Cy Young Award favorite Tarik Skubal leads Detroit's rotation and Jason Foley has become a reliable closer in a strong bullpen.
Riley Greene, an All-Star outfielder, is the team's top player in a lineup that gets timely hitting from the top to the bottom.
